qa_pair.question: Inspect the wine.csv file structure. Which wine class (cultivar) has the most samples in the dataset? Answer with just the class number (1, 2, or 3).
Find all unique wine class values in wine.csv. How many distinct wine classes are represented in the dataset? Answer with just the number.
Get summary statistics for the 'alcohol' column in wine.csv. What is the mean alcohol content across all wines? Round your answer to 2 decimal places.
Analyze the 'proline' column in wine.csv. Which wine class (1, 2, or 3) contains the wine sample with the highest proline value? Answer with just the class number.
Get detailed column information for 'magnesium' in wine.csv. What is the maximum magnesium value found in any wine sample? Provide just the numeric value without units.
Calculate statistics for wines in class 2 only. First filter wine.csv to create a file with only class 2 wines, then compute the mean alcohol content for this subset. Round to 2 decimal places.
Examine wines from class 3 in wine.csv. How many class 3 wine samples have an alcohol content less than 13.0? Answer with just the count.
Inspect the structure of wine.csv and identify all numeric columns. How many total columns (including the class identifier) are in this dataset? Answer with just the number.
Get unique values for the 'class' column in wine.csv. What is the total count of wine samples across all classes combined in the entire dataset? Answer with just the number.
Analyze the 'hue' column statistics in wine.csv. What is the minimum hue value recorded across all wine samples? Provide the exact value to 2 decimal places.
